result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony W Kotvis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: With credit for 0 days time served.

miscConds.notes:
Pay all MANDATORY costs, assessments, surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by Dept of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. ANY CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO BE APPLIED.
Provide DNA sample, pay costs and DNA surcharge.

No contact with firearms.
48 USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.

NO VIOLENT CONTACT with the victim rising to the level of probable cause for arrest for "domestic abuse or harassment".
No new law violations.

Attend and successfully complete Batterers Intervention.
Attend and successfully complete treatment and counseling programs as deemed appropriate by agent.
AODA and recommended treatment including random urine screens/Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.

timeConds.notes: STAYED pending a review on 2-12-2016 at 1:15pm in Branch 38.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Anthony W Kotvis in court.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
  Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.

Defendant Anthony W Kotvis in court with attorney Paul E Bucher.  Jaclyn Schwartz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  AS to count 1:   Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.
Court orders count 2 dismissed and read in for sentencing.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by parties and the defendant.
The court sentenced the defendant to serve 6 months in the House of Correction, with credit for 0 days time served. 
The court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on probation with the WI Department of Corrections for a period of 12 months.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-Serve 25 days in the House of Correction STAYED pending a review on 2-12-2016 at 1:15pm in Branch 38.
-Attend and successfully complete Batterers Intervention .
-AODA and recommended treatment including random urine screens/Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
-Attend and successfully complete treatment and counseling programs as deemed appropriate by agent.
-NO VIOLENT CONTACT with the victim rising to the level of probable cause for arrest for "domestic abuse or harassment".
-Obtain/maintain employment.
-No contact with firearms.
-NO NEW LAW VIOLATIONS.
-Pay all MANDATORY costs, assessments, surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by Dept of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. ANY CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO BE APPLIED.
-Provide DNA sample, pay costs and DNA surcharge.
-48 USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.
RECEIVED & FILED: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief; Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for February 12, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
Statement to the court by Kristin S.  The court will modify to NO VIOLENT CONTACT ORDER.

Defendant Anthony W Kotvis in court with attorney Paul E Bucher.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense is requesting a plea date prior to trial.  Case set for 10-19-2015.  Plea hearing scheduled for October 19, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Victim present in court requesting modification of the No Contact order.  State opposes.  Court orders the No Contact order to remain.

Defendant Anthony W Kotvis in court with attorney Paul E Bucher.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Defense requests Final Pretrial and Jury Trial dates. Court grants defense request. Case adjourned to branch 38.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 6, 2015 at 08:15 am.  Jury trial scheduled for October 21, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Anthony W Kotvis not in court.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Off the record.  Due to branch 4 being down and no DV court available, Pretrial Conference adjourned to Branch 38 on 8-14-2015 at 8:15 am.  Adjourned date was confirmed with Attorney Bucher who will advise defendant.  Parties are advised that EFFECTIVE August 3, 2015, this case will be assigned to JUDGE WAGNER, BRANCH 38, in Room 504 in the Courthouse.   mld
Defendant's Motion to Modify Conditions of Bail, received and filed.   mld

Cash bail that was previously posted to remain.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with K.S. dob 8-3-1987.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.

Defendant Anthony W Kotvis in court with attorney Paul E Bucher.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 04.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 29, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Anthony W Kotvis not in court.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is a possible victim identified, therefore, Court stays order of forfeiture with recompense to be determined at close of case.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 7/10/15 @ 1:30pm
